meanings.definition: A shortened form of the word 'octopus'.
meanings.sent1: The kids at the aquarium were excited to see the occy in the tank.
meanings.sent2: I ordered a delicious dish of fried occy at the seafood restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The occy in the movie was so cute, it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were as fluid and graceful as an occy swimming in the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The occy's tentacles were waving gently in the water, mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: A colloquial term for a temporary or casual job.
meanings.sent1: After school, she worked an occy at the local cafe to earn some extra money.
meanings.sent2: He took on an occy as a delivery driver during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: Finding an occy that pays well can sometimes be a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Working an occy felt like dipping my toes into the world of employment.
meanings.sent5: The occy at the bookstore was a great way to meet new people and learn new skills.

meanings.definition: To occupy or take up space.
meanings.sent1: The large sofa seemed to occy most of the living room.
meanings.sent2: Please don't occy the entire table with your books.
meanings.sent3: His loud laughter occyed the room, making it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent4: The colorful paintings occyed the walls, brightening up the dull room.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh bread occyed the kitchen, making everyone hungry.
